alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Douglas; Paulding; South Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Paulding, northeastern Carroll, Douglas and southwestern Fulton Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Winston, or near Douglasville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Douglasville, Villa Rica, Fairburn, Chattahoochee Hills, Sweetwater Creek State Park, Hannah, Brownsville, Bill Arp, Chapel Hill, Fairplay, Winston, Lake Val-Do-Mar, Treasure Lake, Campbellton and New Georgia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
